alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:59AM EDT until May 01 at 11:07PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Grafton and Belknap Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Swift River at Roxbury. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Closure of Route 17 likely from flood waters, significantly impacting travel in and out of the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EDT Monday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 3.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
